verses.roman:
haridāsa kahe,--"tomāra bhāgyera nāhi sīmā
ye saba varṇilā, ihāra ke jāne mahimā?"

synonyms: hari-dāsa kahe—Haridāsa Ṭhākura says; tomāra—your; bhāgyera—of fortune; nāhi sīmā—there is no limit; ye—whatever; saba—all; varṇilā—you have described; ihāra—of this; ke jāne—who can understand; mahimā—the glories.
translation: Haridāsa Ṭhākura told him: "There is no limit to your good fortune. No one can understand the glories of what you have described."
